title: well i died to red on my first time jungling on 4.20

replies.body:
Ouch, it's hard the first few times on the new Jungle - totally agree. I had lots of problems on my first few rounds on non-heavy sustain junglers D:

A useful thing to remember is the Smite buffs that can help you sustain on the first round -  smiting the Red Buff gives you straight HP and smiting Krug gives you a stun on monsters on hit, which is a pretty massive help too. It's also likely that you don't want to save your smite for the final hit on some of these - you can use their smite buff to beat them (and you'll get it back up sooner)!

yea dude, i like the monster buffs that you get but the first 5 levels is almost impossible for me to gank lanes (due to the fact i only get 2 health pots and i have no sustain) which is frustrating because 
i've always played gank heavy champions like vi and i hate clearing jungle until i am healthy enough to influence lanes

Yeah, I think the big change is that a lot of S4 Gank heavy junglers are going to be better at ganking at really specific times - and some junglers are going to change from being early-game to mid-game strong gankers. 

High sustain low CC junglers are those I think are going to get the biggest boost due to the smite changes - like Warwick, for example, who can get huge value from pre-6 CC via Smite.

Seems generally to me though, that high sustain junglers will gank best at level 2-3, and lower-sustain higher CC junglers better at 5+ ganks.

@Zaps

I have a low-levelled account (pretty sure it's level 12 from memory) on NA I use to play with friends over there. Over the course of the last few weeks I've dedicated the majority of the IP I've earned to picking up champs and as such have not purchased any runes (t3 runes are expensive o_O). I also have a reduced number of mastery points (obviously). 

I've noticed that the buffs to camps has made clearing the jungle REALLY hard due to the lack of these runes and masteries... Like as a result of the changes I find myself backing after the second camp with some junglers, first camp without a very decent leash on others (looking at you {{champion:11}} ). I'm just curious as to whether this was an unintended consequence of the update or if it's designed to keep newer players out of the jungle till they're more experienced with the game?

EDIT:

I also forgot to bring up the fact that junglers now start {{item:1039}}  {{item:2003}} {{item:2003}}  instead of the old {{item:1039}}  {{item:2003}} {{item:2003}} {{item:2003}} {{item:2003}} {{item:2003}}  which hurts ):

Also I used my empowered Q accidentally instead of my empowered W {{champion:107}}

yea mang you really need a leash on frogs if you start there on blue side otherwise i found i was forced to use pot early and got rekt at red, also i probably wasn't aware of the new jungle buffs but its a fun process

I just played a match as Warwick{{champion:19}}  (he really doesn't care much about the new jungle being harder) and I decided to smite Gromp as it spawned and then just take blue buff with my leash. Worked rather well.
You get the buffs from just smiting the big minion of each camp (except of course Red and Blue buff you still must kill for the buff) which means your first camp can be supidly easy with a standard leash.

Well at least Blue is super easy. Red would require taking extra time to walk around after smiting the big krug.

But yeah, if you start blue side, smite gromp, kill blue then kill gromp and move onto wolves, pretty simple really.

Also had some fun with the Shaco{{champion:35}}  jungler from the enemy team, thought he could be a right little prick in my jungle, so I smited the big wolf and out came the little vision sentinel, followed the prick all through my jungle forcing him to run away.
